sections.section_instructions:
The reading passage has six paragraphs, A-F.

Choose the correct heading for each paragraph from the list of headings below.

Write the correct number (i-vii) in boxes.

shared_options.ii: Effects of different types of stress
shared_options.iii: How to protect children from toxic stress
shared_options.iv: An association of adverse experience with health problems and unhealthy habits
shared_options.v: Body’s reactions in response to the perceived harmful event
shared_options.vi: Signs of being under sustained stress
shared_options.vii: Negative impacts of toxic stress on children’s mental health

sections.section_instructions:
Do the following statements agree with the information given in Reading Passage?

In boxes 7-9 on your answer sheet, write:

TRUE if the statement agrees with the information.
FALSE if the statement contradicts the information.
NOT GIVEN If there is no information on this.

questions.question_text: Felitti and Anda were the first to show that ACEs create impacts regarding health and habits later on in life.
Some children have the same level of vulnerability to stressful events.
Several paediatricians consider poverty and racism the primary contributors to toxic stress.

sections.section_instructions:
Look at the following people and the list of statements below.

Match each person with the correct statement, A-E.

Write the correct letter A-E in boxes.

shared_options.A: Traumatic experiences in childhood might lead to poor self-management
shared_options.B: Supportive and responsive relationships with caring parents can prevent or reverse the damaging effects of toxic stress responses.
shared_options.C: Properly naming a type of stress can facilitate its treatment process.
shared_options.D: The real name of a particular form of stress could denounce a number of people.
shared_options.E: Toxic stress can cause the next generations to suffer from negative consequences on both mental and physical health problems.
